triples.name: Free will
triples.relevance: Central philosophical concept debated throughout both reviewed books

triples.name: Evolution
triples.relevance: Key mechanism for how Mitchell argues free will emerged in organisms

triples.name: Natural selection
triples.relevance: Fundamental to Mitchell's argument about how organisms encode knowledge

triples.name: Physics
triples.relevance: Foundation of Sapolsky's deterministic argument about material constraints

triples.name: Quantum mechanics
triples.relevance: Mitchell uses quantum physics interpretation to argue the future is genuinely open

triples.name: Neuroscience
triples.relevance: Field of study addressing how brain and consciousness relate to free will

triples.name: Determinism
triples.relevance: Sapolsky's core argument that all physical systems are deterministic

triples.name: Consciousness
triples.relevance: The hard problem of consciousness relevant to understanding sentience and free will

triples.name: Dualism
triples.relevance: Alternative philosophical position on mind-body relationship discussed as response to determinism

triples.name: Moral responsibility
triples.relevance: Key consequence of the free will debate - whether people can be held responsible for actions

triples.name: Vitalism
triples.relevance: Historical doctrine that Mitchell explicitly rejects while defending the uniqueness of life
